alert.note: Alert for Beaverhead and Western Madison below 6000ft; Madison River Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 22 at 10:12AM MST until February 24 at 5:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 AM MST FRIDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, significant blowing and drifting snow with localized near-whiteout conditions at times. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...The Madison and Beaverhead River Valleys. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 6 PM MST this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 5 PM this afternoon to 5 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Visibilities may drop below 1/4 mile due to falling and blowing snow. Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Persons should consider delaying all travel. Motorists should use extreme caution if travel is absolutely necessary. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Beaverhead and Western Madison below 6000ft; Madison River Valley
